p: Only two cannabinodiol (CBND) type cannabinoids ( 57 and 58) have been reported ( Figure 4). In 1972, cannabinodivirin (CBND-C 3, 57) was detected in hashish by GC-MS analysis [ 41]. In 1977, cannabinodiol (CBND-C 5, 58) was isolated from Lebanese hasish, using silica-gel column chromatography. The structure of CBND-C 5 ( 58) was determined by 1H-NMR and confirmed by the phytochemical transformation of cannabinol into cannabinodiol [ 42].
